column5: First of all, that is a heck of a catch for walleye tackle. I'll bet it was exciting as can be on that light tackle. Congrats, as that is an awesome catch! From my experience with bigger lakers, I have found that most people call a 36" trout a 20# fish. I have heard it countless times. From the 75+ trout I have had in my boat in the 35-36" range, I can honestly say I have not verified a true 20 that was under 36", ever. A 36" fish usually was in that 17-19lb range. Not to say a 36" couldn't weight that, but I haven't seen it. I would estimate your trout as somewhere in the 15-18lb range and if I were betting cash on it, I would put money on it being an honest 16-17 lbs - which in real weights is a heck of a nice Ontario fish for a drive to water. Once again - congrats. I wish I could have been there to see the fight! SL
That fish is all of 40#! What's you guy's don't know Terry only weights 140lbs.
Nice fish narda.thats all that matters and your memory of catching it.i onlybever use myvwalleye gear for them.nothing like a laker fight.
Here's your 40 pounder just for comparison purposes.
Here is mine not even 30#, I think there is a difference.https://uploads.tapatalk-cdn.com/2016...e816ee1ba7.jpgBut nice fishSent from my XT1254 using Tapatalk

I caught this on 9/11/16 on Eagle Lake while fishing with great friends Ernie Bruetsch and Scott Staak. We were jigging for Walleye in Portage Bay. I was using my regular spinning rig with 8lb test and a Lindy Rig and minnow. 35 inches, approx 40 lbs.
Holy CHIT Terry that's a hog !
I hate to burst your bubble , but that fish isn't even close to 40 pounds....
Regardless of the weight, that is a very nice fish! Bill
In Canada we often refer to a 40 ounce bottle of whisky as a "40 pounder". Perhaps Narda is referring to this? Agreed though, a very nice fish regardless.
might not be 40lbs,but shes a bruiser!

40 lbs was an estimate by the person that was handling the net and has spent 60+ years on Eagle, as we didn't have a scale. I wish we did because I would really like to know what the actual weight was. It was a blast catching it and I was with 2 great friends which makes for a great memory.
That is a beautiful laker that would tip the scales at 22-24 pounds. Nice catch and congrats!
